title: Encroachments around Arunachaleshwara temple in Tiruvannamalai demolished to facilitate drain work
content: Most of the encroachments, around 160 structures, on these stretches had been built over two decades ago

title: Faecal contamination beyond permissible limits in Kadambrayar, Chitrapuzha
content: Action plan initiated to check pollution. Directives for setting up sewage treatment plants to be issued; penalty to be imposed on those violating rules under the Water Act

title: Heart surgeries performed on 15 children at Andhra Hospitals
content: Doctors at the paediatric intensive care unit of the Andhra Hospitals have performed about 600 heart surgeries for children over the past few years

title: India’s decision on Indus casts shadow on renewal of India-Bangladesh Ganga Water Treaty: Bangladesh water expert
content: “Renewal of the Ganga treaty will come up next year but if India continues to hold the Indus Waters Treaty in abeyance then it will create doubts about India’s willingness on sharing of river waters with Bangladesh”

title: Women entrepreneurs showcase biodegradable innovations at DRDA workshop
content: Collector G. Lakshmisha assured women entrepreneurs training, loans and market linkages for their products

title: Vice-President lauds T.N. Governor at Vice-Chancellors’ meet
content: Dhankhar says Governor Ravi is vindicating his oath by organising such events, which are extremely relevant to the field of education; he emphasises national interest, calls for innovation in higher education

title: Maharashtra BJP chief denies credit war among allies over Kashmir rescue efforts
content: The Chief Minister’s Office revealed on Thursday that the State government had arranged special IndiGo and Air India flights and brought back 184 tourists to Mumbai

title: Pahalgam terror attack: At Jama Masjid, worshippers join Mirwaiz to observe one-minute silence for victims
content: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq, CM Omar Abdullah denounce attacks on people of J&K elsewhere in nation; ministers deputed to various cities to ensure their safety

title: Kasturirangan took space to people, and beyond
content: Under Dr. Kasturirangan, Indian space programme smoothly graduated from the experimental  phase to operational phase in the areas of earth observation satellites and communication satellites

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Baisaran meadow was always open to public, police permit never sought, says J&K official
content: Baisaran operated by district authority; CRPF tells MPs there is no permanent deployment in upper reaches except during Amarnath yatra; IB says “loose LeT groups are active in upper reaches”

title: Haryana steps up security measures following Pahalgam terror attack
content: Chief Secretary directs vigilance against anti-social elements; DGP calls for revival of peace committees to maintain harmony

title: Will support India as it hunts for those responsible for Pahalgam attack: Tulsi Gabbard
content: We stand in solidarity with India in the wake of the horrific Islamist terrorist attack, targeting and killing 26 Hindus in Pahalgam, says U.S. Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard

title: Govt. revokes 14 categories of visas given to Pakistani nationals
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday called up all the Chief Ministers and asked them to ensure that no Pakistani stays in their States beyond the deadline set for leaving the country.

title: Karnataka HC restrains State and Bescom from mandatory implementation of high-cost smart meters for permanent electricity connections
content: The decision of Bescom is contrary to the Karnataka Electricity Regulatory Commission’s regulation, the court pointed out

title: M.P. farmers to be excluded from CM Kisan Kalyan Scheme if they resort to stubble burning
content: The growing practice of burning crop residue (narwai) after harvest is causing severe environmental damage, says CM Mohan Yadav

title: DRDO makes headway in hypersonic technology
content: The long-duration Active Cooled Scramjet Subscale Combustor ground testing was achieved for more than 1,000 seconds

title: NIA searches 18 locations in Pakistan-backed arms & drugs smuggling case
content: Searches span five States and one Union Territory; agency says it seized electronic devices and other incriminating materials

title: Kasturirangan had a distinct connect with Malnad region
content: He had visited parts of the area before submitting report on Western Ghats as head of the high-level committee

title: Why was PM campaigning in Bihar instead of attending all-party meet, ask Trinamool MPs
content: In an hour of grave crisis, the Prime Minister must be the one taking the opposition into confidence, says Sagarika Ghose

title: Police conduct cordon and search operations in Kurnool
content: Police searched homes of old offenders, rowdy sheeters and troublemakers. Drones were and foot patrolling done

title: Naidu invites Modi for relaunch of Amaravati works, extends solidarity in wake of Pahalgam attack
content: We are with you, and the whole country stands with you in whatever decision you take in the interest of the nation, CM tells PM

title: No delays, no excuses: Telangana begins deportation of 33 Pakistani nationals
content: While the Attari border remains the designated land exit point for Pakistani nationals until April 30, those travelling by air must depart via Delhi or Mumbai. Passengers flying out of Hyderabad will need to transit through Saudi Arabia or Dubai.

title: Kerala government amends liquor rules to allow sale of legal liquor in State-owned IT parks
content: At a stroke, the government appears to hold forth a salve to assuage the software and start-up sectors’ longstanding grievance that the lack of high-spirited socialising venues rendered Kerala a dull job destination for techies

title: Kathakali maddalam maestro Kalamandalam Narayanan Nair passes away
content: A disciple of the legendary Kalamandalam Appukutti Poduval, Narayanan Nair was known for his disciplined and distinctive style of percussion

title: COFEPOSA Act invoked against Ranya Rao
content: If the High Court upholds the order, she will be kept under preventive detention for one year without bail

title: Governor Arlekar stresses Pope Francis’ message of peace and unity
content: Governor leads a solemn condolence meeting at the Lourde Forane church in Thiruvananthapuram to mourn the passing of Pope Francis

title: Pakistan needs a terrible blow and the country will be with PM in fighting terrorism: Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy
content: Thousands of people joined the march, including Deputy Chief Minister Bhatti Vikramarka, Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi, and former Union minister Salman Khurshid and the Telangana Cabinet to pay homage to the Pahalgam victims

title: K. Kasturirangan, A meticulous person who helmed ISRO in challenging times
content: The former chairman of the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) who passed away in Bengaluru, was once known as the “Chairman with golden fingers” in the ISRO community,

title: Airspace closure unlikely to hit Kerala directly, transit passengers to face headwinds
content: It is unlikely to affect the majority of  airlines operating from Kerala, where more than 95% of the operations are toward the Gulf and the Far East

title: India will not allow single drop of water from Indus River into Pakistan: Union Minister Paatil
content: Mr. Paatil said India has sent a strong message to Pakistan that it will not tolerate terrorism at all

title: Watch: Pahalgam terror attack | Is a military confrontation likely?
content: The diplomatic aftermath of the terror attack in Pahalgam, where 25 Indians and 1 Nepali tourist were gunned down brutally, is ongoing, and the question now is, what next?

title: CPI(M) cautions against divisive forces emotionally exploiting the Pahalgam massacre to divide Kerala along communal lines
content: CPI(M) State secretary notes that the daughter of an Ernakulam resident, Ramachandran, who was martyred in Pahalgam, had come under intense cyber assault from Hindutva handles in Kerala for reminiscing about the help rendered by “ Kashmir’s Muslim brothers” in the attack’s aftermath

title: Meet on Thrissur Pooram discusses safety aspects
content: Minister calls for collaboration from all parties involved, including the Pooram organising committee and elephant owners, to maintain high safety standards

title: After Assam MLA, eight arrested in Northeast for offensive post on Pahalgam terror attack
content: Seven of those booked, including a journalist and a university student, are from Assam, while one is from Meghalaya’s Shillong

title: Chittoor police gear up to combat summer housebreaks
content: To prevent thefts and secure vacant homes, Chittoor police have install 3,000 CCTVs, distribute 16,500 smart locks and ask citizens going out for summer holidays to register on the LHMS app

title: Over a dozen annual reports of SC, ST and OBC panels yet to be made public
content: The SC and ST panels are two years behind on their reports, and the OBC panel is three years behind. Apart from this, one SC panel report and five ST panel reports are with the President but have not been made public

title: Protests against Pakistan over Pahalgam terror attack mark Friday prayers in Sambhal
content: People wear black bands as a mark of mourning in mosques across many Uttar Pradesh towns, demand strict action against the neighbouring country

title: Rally taken out in Ongole to create awareness on malaria
content: All PHCs in the district have facilities for malaria diagnosis and treatment, says Collector A. Thameem Ansaria

title: Ernakulam GH likely to perform its first heart transplant procedure in May
content: The hospital authorities began preparations to perform heart transplant after the institution received licence for the procedure from the Kerala State Organ and Tissue Transplant Organisation in December last year

title: Bureaucrats tell aspirants not to be harsh on themselves while preparing for Civil Services Examination
content: IAS officers Divya S. Iyer and Vivek K.V. speak at webinar on Cracking Civil Services the Smart Way, held as a prelude to the Civil Services Gateway 2025 event to be held at Hotel Hycinth Confluence, Thiruvananthapuram, on May 9 and 10

title: Court grants three-day custody of former Intelligence Director-General Anjaneyulu to CID police
content: Currently serving his judicial remand in the Vijayawada jail, the suspended IPS officer has been arrested in the alleged illegal arrest and harassment of actor Kadambari Jethwani

title: Fishermen families expect more incentives from Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister during his tour to Srikakulam district on April 26
content: Hundreds of fishermen have been migrating to Gujarat, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu and other places in search of livelihood due to limited opportunities in Srikakulam district

title: Sources: Morant out for Game 4 with hip injury
content: Grizzlies superstar Ja Morant is out for Saturday's Game 4 because of a left hip injury he suffered in Game 3, sources told ESPN.

title: Arenas out of coma day after crash, family says
content: USC recruit Alijah Arenas is out of an induced coma but remains intubated as he recovers from a crash in the Los Angeles area.

title: Ward gets Moon's blessing to wear Titans' No. 1
content: Warren Moon gave his blessing to Cam Ward to wear the No. 1 jersey, saying the rookie QB has "a chance to create a great legacy for that number" with the Titans.

title: Rockets' Brooks calls Warriors' Green dirty player
content: Dillon Brooks sticks up for Amen Thompson, saying his Rockets teammate is not a dirty player, but that Golden State's Draymond Green is.

title: Madrid to play Copa final despite protest over refs
content: Real Madrid denied they were considering boycotting Saturday's Copa del Rey final against Barcelona, despite protesting comments made by the refereeing team.

title: Warriors list Butler as questionable for Game 3
content: Warriors forward Jimmy Butler is listed as questionable for Game 3 of Golden State's first-round playoff series against the Rockets after he sustained a pelvic contusion in a hard fall during Game 2.

title: LSU lands ex-S.C. guard Fulwiley as transfer
content: Former South Carolina guard MiLaysia Fulwiley is transferring to LSU, landing the Tigers one of the most coveted players in the portal.

title: Poirier to close career vs. Holloway at UFC 318
content: UFC veteran Dustin Poirier will close out his career vs. Max Holloway for the BMF title at UFC 318 in New Orleans on July 19.

title: 2025 NFL draft: Pros and cons for every first-round pick
content: After Cam Ward was taken with pick No. 1 by Tennessee, a couple of surprising trades -- which saw the Jaguars and Giants move up -- highlighted the opening round.

title: Luka, LeBron and the most dangerous 60-foot passes in the game
content: These mega-outlets illustrate a growing Lakers connection that should strike fear across the NBA. And they're only going to happen more.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Will the Canadiens, Devils, Oilers get on the board?
content: All three teams returned home down 0-2. Can they turn the tide? Plus, Thursday's highlights and Three Stars.

title: 'There's no drop-off down there': How the bottom of the order is powering the Cubs' offense to top of MLB
content: Chicago has scored more runs than any team in the majors so far -- with the help of some unexpected sluggers.

title: Slow start? Not this year! Francisco Lindor has Mets rolling
content: After stumbling out of the gate last season, the star shortstop and his team are lighting up Citi Field.

title: What the Jaxson Dart pick means for Brian Daboll, Joe Schoen
content: The 21-year-old Ole Miss product is positioned to be the Giants' QB of the future, but he might not play in 2025.

title: Trump Says Ukraine Has Not Signed Minerals Deal
content: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday said Ukraine has not yet signed a deal on rare earth minerals and he hopes it will be signed immediately.

title: "There Is Tension Between India, Pakistan But...": Donald Trump On J&K Attack
content: India and Pakistan will figure out relations between themselves, US President Donald Trump said on Friday as tensions soared between the two neighboring countries after a terror attack in Jammu & Kashmir's Pahalgam.

title: "Not Even A Drop...": How India Plans To Stem Flow Of Indus Water To Pak
content: Emphasising the importance of suspending the Indus Waters Treaty, Union Jal Shakti Minister CR Patil has said India will ensure that not even a "drop of water" from the Indus river goes to Pakistan.

title: "Even If It Means Merging PoK...": Revanth Reddy To PM Modi On J&K Attack
content: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy on Friday led a candle march to protest the Pahalgam terror attack, which claimed 26 lives, and urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to give a befitting reply to Pakistan, even if it means merging PoK.

title: FBI Chief Kash Patel's 'Judge Arrested In Migrant Case' Post Vanishes From X
content: FBI chief Kash Patel finds himself in a spot after hastily posting about a judge's arrest on his social media handle on X. The case in question was about an undocumented migrant who was allegedly evading federal agents who were pursuing him.

title: Maharashtra Minister's "Ask Religion" Advice To Hindus Days After J&K Attack
content: Maharashtra minister Nitesh Rane on Friday said Hindus should ask the religion of shopkeepers before buying anything from them, controversial remarks coming in the backdrop of the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Indus Water Treaty Was "Most Unfair Document" To People Of J&K: Omar Abdullah
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah Friday said the Indus Water Treaty (IWT) with Pakistan that has been put in abeyance by the Centre in the wake of the Pahalgam attack was the "most unfair document" to the people of the Union territory.

title: "Sad To See People Attacking My Brothers, Sisters From Kashmir": Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Friday said the terror attack in Jammu & Kashmir's Pahalgam was carried out with an intent to "divide society" and urged the nation to stand united "to fight this nasty action" and defeat terrorism.

title: Object Falls From Air Force Aircraft, Damages House In Madhya Pradesh
content: A "metal object" that fell from an Indian Air Force (IAF) aircraft caused severe damage to a house in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri district on Friday, but nobody was injured, police said.

title: How To Prevent Walking Into Trap Set By Pak? Ex Navy Chief Arun Prakash Says...
content: Admiral Arun Prakash (retired) has cautioned people against going on a path that Pakistan's ISI wants Indians to take amid the rising tension between the two neighbours, days after Pakistan-linked terrorists killed 26 tourists in Pahalgam.

title: 3 Girls, Woman Raped By 6 Men And A Minor At Forest In Madhya Pradesh
content: Three girls and a woman returning from a wedding were gang-raped by six adults and a minor in a forest in Madhya Pradesh's Balaghat district on Friday.

title: As US Reinstates Revoked Student Visas, Its Impact On Indians, Others
content: The terminations, which were made from a database used by universities and the federal government to track foreign students in the US, had caused panic among the affected students.

title: 8, Including MLA, Arrested For Comments 'Supporting Pak' After J&K Attack
content: At least 8 have been arrested by the Assam Police as part of an "intensified crackdown" against individuals who have "directly or indirectly" supported Pakistan after Tuesday's terror attack in J&K's Pahalgam, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said.

title: "With You As You Hunt Down...": US Spy Chief To PM Modi On Kashmir Attack
content: US' Director of National Intelligence, Tulsi Gabbard, wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday, paying homage to those who were killed in the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam this week.

title: Will 'Lead The Pack' On Iran Attack If No Nuclear Deal: Donald Trump
content: President Donald Trump said the United States will "lead the pack" in attacking Iran if talks over Tehran's nuclear program do not result in a new deal, according to a Time Magazine interview.

title: Complaint Against Blusmart Founders' Firm For Alleged Document Fraud
content: Indian state-owned renewables lender filed a complaint with the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) against Gensol Engineering and begun an internal review over an alleged submission of falsified documents, it said on Friday.

title: Naga Insurgent Group NSCN-IM Alleges Conspiracy After Houses Set On Fire In Manipur's Kamjong
content: The civil arm of the NSCN (IM) has asked people not to fall for "malicious disinformation" after posts on social media and WhatsApp groups alleged the Naga insurgent group set fire to houses in two villages in Manipur's Kamjong district.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: 'Hunt them down', says US amid support for action by India
content: Following the Pahalgam attack that killed 26 Hindus, the US has strongly supported India in hunting down the Islamist terrorists responsible. US officials, including Intelligence czar Tulsi Gabbard and President Trump, have pledged full support to India, signaling a departure from previous administrations' cautious approach.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: 'Trousers of 20 men were pulled down to find out faith'
content: Following the Pahalgam attack, a grim discovery was made: the trousers of approximately 20 male victims were unzipped or pulled down. Officials believe this indicates terrorists attempted to ascertain the victims' faith before their execution.

title: SEVIS being restored in US; relief for impacted Indian students
content: The Trump administration has seemingly reversed its controversial SEVIS termination policy, reactivating records for numerous international students across the U.S., even those not involved in lawsuits. This shift follows widespread criticism and legal challenges to the abrupt terminations, which were often based on questionable NCIC data.

title: Water, trade, visas & more: India's 10 bold moves within 72 hrs of Pahalgam attack
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, India has taken decisive actions, including suspending the Indus Waters Treaty and downgrading diplomatic ties with Pakistan. Visas for Pakistani nationals are suspended, and the Attari border crossing is closed. The Indian Navy conducted missile tests, and the Air Force launched a major drill.

title: AR Rahman song identical to Dagar bros' work: Delhi HC
content: The Delhi High Court has directed A.R. Rahman and Madras Talkies to deposit ₹2 crore after finding their song 'Veera Raja Veera' from 'Ponniyin Selvan 2' to be a copyright infringement of the 'Shiva Stuti' composed by the Junior Dagar brothers. Justice Prathiba M.

title: Jagan 'final recipient' of Andhra booze scam kickbacks, says SIT
content: A SIT report alleges ex-CM Y S Jagan Mohan Reddy was the "final recipient" of kickbacks from distilleries in Andhra Pradesh, starting in 2019. The alleged scam involved coercing distilleries to pay commissions, with funds laundered through hawala networks. The money trail purportedly leads to senior YSRCP figures before reaching Jagan, with suspect Booneti Chanakya playing a central role.

title: 19 states sue Trump administration over DEI programs in public schools
content: Nineteen states are challenging the Trump administration's policy on diversity in schools. They filed a lawsuit against the Education Department's directive. The directive threatened to cut funding for non-compliance. States argue the directive harms students and schools. They say it puts federal funding at risk. Earlier, judges blocked parts of the directive in three states.

title: ‘I’m doing the work’: Melinda Gates responds to Elon Musk, Bezos' ex-wife criticism
content: Melinda Gates addressed criticisms from tech leaders like Elon Musk and MacKenzie Scott regarding her philanthropic endeavors, emphasizing her commitment to impactful work through the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation and Pivotal Ventures.

title: 10 Pakistani soldiers killed in Quetta bombing, BLA takes responsibility
content: The Balochistan Liberation Army (BLA) claimed responsibility for a roadside bomb attack in Quetta, resulting in the deaths of ten Pakistani military personnel and injuries to three others. The attack, which targeted a bomb disposal squad vehicle in the Margat area, involved a remote-controlled improvised explosive device.

title: At first Friday prayer in weeks, Mirwaiz slams Pahalgam carnage
content: Kashmir's chief cleric Mirwaiz Umar Farooq, after a month of restrictions, delivered a Friday sermon at Srinagar's Jamia Masjid, condemning the Pahalgam massacre and honoring the victims. He recalled his father's assassination and expressed solidarity with the bereaved families. Mirwaiz lauded Kashmiris' hospitality, highlighting locals' efforts to help victims, including the sacrifice of Adil Hussain.

title: Pak defence minister admits his country harbours terror organisations
content: Pakistan's defence minister, Khawaja Asif, admitted on Sky News that Pakistan has harbored and funded terror organizations, claiming they were doing the West's "dirty work" for decades. He stated these groups are essentially one religiously organized entity with different fronts. Asif also accused India of staging the Pahalgam attack and threatened retaliation for any Indian aggression, urging US intervention.

title: How China is trying to stop Apple’s ‘big’ iPhone move to India
content: Apple is accelerating its iPhone production shift to India, aiming to manufacture all US-bound iPhones there by 2026 due to US tariffs on Chinese imports. This ambitious plan requires doubling India's current iPhone output.

title: 'Not a drop ...': Roadmap ready to leave Pakistan high & dry
content: Following a meeting with Home Minister Amit Shah, Union Jal Shakti Minister CR Paatil announced a detailed plan to prevent Indian river water from flowing into Pakistan. The government is considering short, medium, and long-term strategies, including immediate desilting of rivers.

title: Special J&K assembly session on Monday over Pahalgam attack
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack and advice from the Omar Abdullah-led government, Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha has convened a special J&K assembly session on April 28. Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi met with Sinha, urging decisive action to bring the attackers to justice. The National Conference had formally requested the special session after the recent attack.

title: IPL: Harshal's four-fer shines as CSK crumble in Dhoni's 400 T20 match
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad spoiled MS Dhoni's 400th T20 appearance, defeating Chennai Super Kings by five runs. Harshal Patel's impressive 4 for 28 led SRH's dominant pace attack, restricting CSK to 154 in pursuit of 149. Despite resistance from Brevis and Mhatre, CSK lost wickets consistently, ultimately succumbing to SRH's relentless bowling performance.

title: Pahalgam attack: Police detain pony rider after he asked a tourist her religion
content: Jammu and Kashmir police have detained a pony service provider, Aiyaz Ahmad Jungal, following a viral video where a tourist alleged he questioned her about her religion. The tourist claimed this occurred during a mule ride in Pahalgam, two days before the terror attack.

title: Search ops in 6 Jammu districts intensified to track down hiding terrorists
content: Security forces have intensified search operations across six districts of the Jammu division to locate terrorists believed to be hiding in forest areas. This follows a gunfight in Udhampur where a Special Forces soldier was killed. Combing operations are underway in Kishtwar, Rajouri, Kathua, and Poonch, with heightened efforts to sanitize the Kathua-Samba region after recent encounters.

title: Evra eyes Suárez MMA fight: 'He can even bite me'
content: Former Manchester United defender Patrice Evra will make his debut as an MMA fighter in a "showcase bout" on May 23 in Paris, the PFL has announced.

title: Reynolds: Wrexham promotion bid given me ulcer
content: Wrexham co-owner Ryan Reynolds has said the crucial last weeks of Wrexham's bid for promotion have developed "an eight-inch ulcer in my stomach."

title: Chelsea-bound Estêvão scores, vomits in Copa win
content: Palmeiras' Estêvão had an 18th birthday to remember, netting the club's second goal in a 3-2 Copa Libertadores win over Bolivar before dropping to the turf, vomiting and leaving the field on a stretcher as the high altitude of La Paz took its toll.

title: Flick: Young Barça team have to enjoy Copa final
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick wants his young team to enjoy Saturday's Copa del Rey final against Real Madrid and forget their two Clásico wins already this season.

title: Vancouver blanks Messi's Miami in CCC first semi
content: Vancouver Whitecaps took a decisive 2-0 victory over Inter Miami in the first leg of the CONCACAF Champions Cup semifinal in front of an attendance record of 53,837 spectators at BC Place.

title: USWNT's Tullis-Joyce signs new Man Utd contract
content: United States goalkeeper Phallon Tullis-Joyce has extended her contract at Manchester United until 2028, the Women's Super League side announced.

title: NWSL seeks to launch second division in 2026
content: The National Women's Soccer League has formally applied to the U.S. Soccer Federation to create a new Division II league.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: 2025 NFL draft: Fantasy football analysis of Round 1
content: Liz Loza, Matt Bowen and Mike Clay break down the fantasy potential of early-round rookies from the NFL draft and provide initial 2025 projections.

title: 'Her journey is different from all of ours': Sooners' Tia Milloy leans on family legacy in debut season
content: An ex-NFL father, All-American track star mother and two softball standouts for sisters have helped ground Oklahoma's Tia Milloy.

title: Jim Schlossnagle is at the center of the Texas-Texas A&M storm
content: As if the Texas-Texas A&M rivalry needed more, Jim Schlossnagle's decision to switch rivals adds all the extra drama.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs odds: Stars a top 5 favorite after Game 3 win over Avalanche
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: The biggest question facing every WNBA team when training camp opens Sunday
content: Who will carry Phoenix into its new era? What will Reese and Cardoso do in Year 2? Are the Fever title contenders?

title: Should you draft Clark or Wilson at No. 1?
content: A'ja Wilson opened as the top ranked player in fantasy women's basketball entering the 2025 season, but does someone else have a case to supplant Wilson in 2025?

title: How Hamilton helped Idris, Pitt bring 'F1' movie to life
content: With real race cars and Lewis Hamilton advising, Damson Idris talks the realism of filming June's "F1" movie.

title: Man Mortgages Mother's Jewellery For Sweeper's Job, Gets Cheated: Police
content: A man was booked for allegedly cheating a BMC job aspirant who had raised Rs 8 lakh for the purpose by mortgaging his mother's gold jewellery, a Mumbai police official said on Friday.

title: Dowry Death Affects Foundation Of Dignity But No Blanket Ban On Bail: Court
content: Offence of dowry death strikes at the foundations of dignity, equality and justice in domestic life, but there is no blanket prohibition against the grant of bail in such cases, the Delhi High Court has said.

title: DRDO takes major step towards next-gen hypersonic cruise missiles
content: The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) has achieved a significant milestone by conducting a scramjet combustor ground test for over 1,000 seconds at its Hyderabad facility. This successful test validates the design for long-duration scramjet combustors, paving the way for full-scale flight testing. This advancement is crucial for India's Hypersonic Cruise Missile Development Programme, enabling high-speed, long-duration flight capabilities.

title: Why Pakistanis are trolling themselves over 'war' with India
content: In the hours after the Pahalgam massacre, where 26 people were executed by Pakistan-backed terrorists, the world followed its usual script—India condemned, Pakistan denied, and the West euphemised. But this time, something changed. The sharpest response didn’t come from New Delhi or Washington—it came from ordinary Pakistanis, who didn’t defend the state but ridiculed it. On social media, they didn’t rage against India. They mocked their own power cuts, fuel shortages, and economic collapse. In a country where laughter is all that’s left, post-tragedy grief turned into post-collapse satire. The lights may flicker, but the punchlines never miss.

title: Musk replies to JD Vance's family photos from Taj Mahal: One of the ...
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, recently visited the Taj Mahal during a four-day trip to India. Vance shared photos on X, with Elon Musk commenting on the monument's beauty. The family's visit included a warm welcome from Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister and stringent security measures along their route.

title: IPL 2025 Points Table: Latest standings after CSK vs SRH match
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad broke their losing streak with a dominant five-wicket victory over Chennai Super Kings at Chepauk, marking their first win at the venue. SRH's pace attack, led by Harshal Patel's 4 for 28, restricted CSK to 154. Ishan Kishan's 44 and a late partnership sealed the win, boosting SRH's playoff hopes while deepening CSK's struggles.

title: Sourav Ganguly backs severing ties with Pakistan after Pahalgam attack
content: Sourav Ganguly has firmly advocated for severing relations with Pakistan following the deadly terrorist attack in Pahalgam, which resulted in 26 fatalities. He emphasised that terrorism should not be tolerated and strict measures are essential. The BCCI has condemned the attack, observing a minute's silence and wearing black armbands during an IPL match as a mark of respect.

title: Amit Mishra lambasts Riyan Parag: 'Why blame others?'
content: Veteran spinner Amit Mishra has strongly criticised Riyan Parag's captaincy and performance after Rajasthan Royals' defeat to Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Mishra highlighted Parag's errors during crucial moments, including a dropped catch and poor shot selection, contributing to the loss. RR's batting faltered despite promising starts from Jaiswal and Jurel, while Hazlewood's exceptional bowling sealed RCB's victory, ending RR's playoff hopes.

title: 'Sukhu should resign for Pahalgam': J'khand min's gaffe, botched coverup
content: Jharkhand's minister Sudivya Kumar stirred controversy by demanding Himachal CM's resignation following the Pahalgam terror attack. Later when he tried to clarify his remarks, he ended up taking the name of PDP chief Mahbooba Mufti instead of Omar Abdullah who is the chief minister of J&K.

title: No fruits, vegetables, milk or meat left in Gaza as WFP runs out of food stocks
content: The World Food Programme reports its Gaza food stocks are depleted due to Israel's blockade, impacting hundreds of thousands relying on charity kitchens. These kitchens, supporting 80% of Gaza's population with 644,000 daily meals, face imminent closure. Israel's actions, including cutting off supplies, aim to pressure Hamas for hostage release.

title: Usha Vance isn’t the only high achiever in her family— Meet her sister, Shreya Chilukuri
content: Usha Vance, an Indian-American, is gaining prominence alongside her husband, US Vice President JD Vance. While Usha navigates political life, her sister, Shreya Chilukuri, excels in engineering. A Duke University graduate, Shreya contributed to missile development at Raytheon and now works at ASML, a leading semiconductor company.

title: Senior Russian military personnel killed in targeted car bombing
content: A senior Russian general, Yaroslav Moskalik, was killed in a car bombing in Balashikha, a Moscow suburb. The incident occurred on the same day a US envoy met with Vladimir Putin, raising suspicions of Ukrainian involvement. Russian authorities have launched a criminal investigation, with a foreign ministry spokeswoman accusing Kyiv of escalating attacks and attempting to disrupt ceasefire talks.

title: Watch: Kavya Maran's animated reaction to Harshal Patel's drop catch
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad's dominant bowling performance against Chennai Super Kings was overshadowed by co-owner Kavya Maran's expressive reaction to a dropped catch. Harshal Patel's dropped catch of Ravindra Jadeja sparked Maran's visible frustration, quickly going viral. Despite the let-off, Patel rebounded with a four-wicket haul, showcasing the emotional highs and lows of the game.

title: 'We've been doing dirty work ...': Pak admits supporting terror groups
content: Pakistan's defence minister admitted to undertaking "dirty work" for the United States and the West for three decades, acknowledging it as a mistake that led to suffering. Following the Pahalgam attack, which resulted in 26 deaths, the government responded by suspending the Indus Waters Treaty, closing the Attari ICP, and reducing diplomatic staff.

title: Aleksander Barkov injury: Florida Panthers' captain departs Game 2
content: Aleksander Barkov exited Game 2 against the Tampa Bay Lightning after a collision with Brandon Hagel, casting a shadow over Florida's 2-0 victory and their 2-0 series lead. Hagel received a five-minute major for interference, a decision disputed by the Lightning's coach. The Panthers now face uncertainty regarding Barkov's availability for Game 3.

title: Catch of IPL 2025? Mendis pulls off stunner to dismiss Brevis - Watch
content: In a thrilling IPL 2025 match, Kamindu Mendis of Sunrisers Hyderabad stunned spectators with an extraordinary catch, dismissing Dewald Brevis. Mendis's athletic feat is already being touted as the 'Catch of the Tournament'. Earlier, Ravindra Jadeja and Noor Ahmad faced unexpected umpire inspections, leading to bat replacements due to regulation failures.

title: 'Canada is an interesting case': Trump says he's not trolling with talks of 51st state
content: In an exclusive interview, President Trump stated his belief that Canada becoming the 51st US state is the only viable solution, claiming the US loses billions annually supporting them. Liberal leader Mark Carney confirmed that in his last call with Trump in March, Trump raised the issue but was respectful about Canada's sovereignty.

title: Israel's Netanyahu calls Hamas 'Nazis' at Holocaust memorial
content: Israel marked Holocaust Remembrance Day amidst the Gaza conflict, with a ceremony at Yad Vashem. Prime Minister Netanyahu likened Hamas to Nazis, a comparison Yad Vashem discourages. A Holocaust survivor, Gad Fartouk, broke protocol, calling for the return of hostages held in Gaza.

title: US offers full support to help India hunt down terrorists
content: Following the deadly terrorist attack in Pahalgam, which claimed 26 lives, US Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard voiced strong support for India. Gabbard condemned the attack, affirmed solidarity with India and Prime Minister Modi, and expressed condolences to the victims' families. US officials, including President Trump, have reiterated their commitment to supporting India in combating terrorism.

title: Four tribal girls gangraped by 7 in MP
content: In Balaghat district, Madhya Pradesh, four tribal girls, including three minors, were kidnapped by seven individuals on April 23 after a wedding reception. The girls were intercepted while returning to their village. All the accused have been identified and are now in police custody, facing charges under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, POCSO Act, and SC/ST Act.

title: Chris Eubank Jr.-Conor Benn timeline: How their rivalry unfolded
content: Nick Parkinson looks at the rivalry between Eubank and Benn that started decades ago between their fathers.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Contract delay opens door to Barcelona exit for Raphinha?
content: Raphinha is struggling to agree a new contract with Barcelona as Saudi Pro League clubs watch on. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Punjab Kings coach reveals reason behind Shreyas Iyer's resurgence
content: Shreyas Iyer's impressive IPL 2025 performance, marked by significant scores and consistency against spin, has sparked discussions about his potential return to the national team. Sunil Joshi, Punjab Kings' spin coach, attributes Iyer's success to his hunger for challenges and leadership qualities. Iyer's technical adjustments and team-oriented approach further contribute to his resurgence.

title: Unique record! Mohd Shami makes IPL history as first bowler to ...
content: Mohammed Shami etched his name in IPL record books by becoming the first bowler to claim a first-ball wicket for the fourth time, dismissing Shaik Rasheed in the SRH vs CSK match. Rasheed and Ayush Mhatre also made history as the second-youngest opening pair in IPL history, with a combined age of 38 years and 131 days.

title: Drama at Chepauk! Jadeja's bat fails umpire's gauge test - Watch
content: In an unusual incident during the IPL match between Chennai Super Kings and Sunrisers Hyderabad, Ravindra Jadeja's bat failed the umpire's inspection due to size regulations. This forced Jadeja to change his bat immediately after Sam Curran's dismissal. Sunrisers Hyderabad chose to bowl first after winning the toss, leading to strategic lineup changes for both teams.

title: New record! 43-yo MS Dhoni becomes 4th Indian to...
content: MS Dhoni marked his 400th T20 match, joining an elite group of Indian cricketers. His career, highlighted by a T20 World Cup win and five IPL titles with CSK, showcases his enduring impact. Despite CSK's current struggles, Dhoni's tactical acumen and unwavering fan support continue to define his legendary presence.

title: Sehwag warns 14-yo Suryavanshi: 'Seen many players who get fame ...'
content: Indian cricket legend Virender Sehwag advises young IPL sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi, cautioning him against complacency. Despite Suryavanshi's impressive debut and lucrative contract, Sehwag stresses the importance of long-term dedication, citing Virat Kohli's enduring career as an example. Sehwag warns that early success doesn't guarantee lasting impact, emphasizing the need for sustained performance and grounded perspective.

title: Indus water pact suspended: How India can punish Pak
content: Following a terrorist attack in Pahalgam, India has suspended the Indus Waters Treaty with Pakistan, halting data sharing and potentially allowing for increased water usage from the western rivers. This action marks a significant escalation in tensions, threatening Pakistan's water supply and agriculture, though immediate impact is unlikely due to infrastructure limitations.

title: Pahalgam attack: Kashmiri families open hearts & homes to tourists
content: Following the terror attack in Pahalgam, scared tourists found refuge in the homes of Kashmiris, who opened their doors and hearts. These acts of kindness transcended fear, with families like the Maliks offering shelter and refusing payment, prioritizing the safety of tourists over business.

title: NBA playoff odds: Thunder up 3-0 on Memphis, solidify championship favorite status
content: the top-seeded Oklahoma City Thunder entered the playoffs as favorites to win the NBA championship . the Los Angeles Lakers , Golden State Warriors , LA Clippers and Minnesota Timberwolves have the second-best odds to take home the title . they are up 2-0 in their opening round series with the Orlando Magic .

title: The time is now: Projecting John Cena's final WWE matches
content: the last time in his career, John Cena has won a title for the 17th time in 2025 . the biggest storyline in WWE will be surrounding his quest to bring the title home with him "forever" we don't know, but wrestling fans love to make predictions and that's what we will do here .
